item.title: Harry add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "When men stop believing in God, it isn't that they then believe in nothing: they believe in everything." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Harry add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Harry add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "I have very carefully studied Islam and the life of its Prophet (PBUH). I have done so both as a student of history and as a critic. And I have come to conclusion that Muhammad (PBUH) was indeed a great man and a deliverer and benefactor of mankind which was till then writhing under the most agonising Pain." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Harry add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Muhammad (PBUH) is not the father of any man among you, but He is Messenger of Allah and the last of the Prophets. And Allah is Ever AllAware of everything." (Surah Ahzaab Ch33 V40)" -- Anonymous

item.title: Harry add a quote by Muhammad
item.description: "The search of knowledge is an obligation laid on every Muslim." -- Muhammad

item.title: Harry add a quote by Muhammad Ibn Abdullah
item.description: "The ink of the scholar is holier than the blood of the martyr." -- Muhammad Ibn Abdullah

item.title: Harry add a quote by adolf hitler
item.description: "If you tell a big enough lie and tell it frequently enough, it will be believed." -- adolf hitler

item.title: Harry add a quote by Adolf Hitler
item.description: "It is not truth that matters, but victory." -- Adolf Hitler

item.title: Harry add a quote by Adolf Hitler
item.description: "When diplomacy ends, War begins." -- Adolf Hitler

item.title: Harry add a quote by Adolf Hitler
item.description: "Those who want to live, let them fight, and those who do not want to fight in this world of eternal struggle do not deserve to live." -- Adolf Hitler

item.title: Harry add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Harry add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Harry add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "The only thing we have to fear is fear itself." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Harry add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Harry add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Harry add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "I did then what I knew how to do. Now that I know better, I do better." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Harry add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Harry add a quote by Phil Collins
item.description: "In learning you will teach, and in teaching you will learn." -- Phil Collins
